body.name: Garmin Forerunner® 965 Running Smartwatch, Colorful AMOLED Display, Training Metrics and Recovery Insights, Black and Powder Gray, 010-02809-00
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 44 mins
features: Brilliant AMOLED touchscreen display with traditional button controls and lightweight titanium bezel
Battery life: up to 23 days of battery life in smartwatch mode, up to 31 hours in GPS mode
Confidently run any route using full-color, built-in maps and multi-band GPS

Training readiness score is based on sleep quality, recovery, training load and HRV status to determine if you’re primed to go hard and reap the rewards (data presented is intended to be a close estimation of metrics tracked)

Plan race strategy with personalized daily suggested workouts based on the race and course that you input into the Garmin Connect app and then view the race widget on your watch; daily suggested workouts adapt after every run to match performance and recovery
Switch between sports with a button press by using built-in profiles for triathlons, duathlons, brick workouts and swimruns — or customize your own multisport profiles

Using indicators such as HRV status, recent exercise history and performance, get insight into overall effort with training status — and know whether you’re training productively, peaking or strained (data presented is intended to be a close estimation of metrics tracked)

As soon as you wake up, get your morning report with an overview of sleep, recovery and training outlook alongside HRV status, training readiness and weather (data presented is intended to be a close estimation of metrics tracked)
Multi-band GNSS with SatIQ technology provides superior accuracy in challenging environments while also optimizing the device’s battery life

Get wrist-based running dynamics, including cadence, stride length, ground contact time and more, plus wrist-based running power, which gives you a continuous measurement of how much power you’re applying to the road
body.description: Train brilliantly with Forerunner® 965, the premium GPS running and triathlon smartwatch with a bright AMOLED touchscreen display and lightweight titanium bezel. Wake up to your morning report with HRV status to see health insights with an overview of sleep, recovery and training outlook (data presented is intended to be a close estimation of metrics tracked). The training readiness feature tells you when you’re primed for a productive session — while daily suggested workouts adapt to performance and recovery alongside the race widget, which provides training tips, course details and completion time predictions. Navigate any route confidently with multi-band GPS and full-color, built-in maps. With traditional buttons and a touchscreen display, it’s easy to tap into your training status and know whether you’re training productively, peaking or strained. If you’re pushing to outshine the competition, the Forerunner 965 is there to light up every run with up to 23 days of battery life in smartwatch mode.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great tri watch
reviews.reviewText: The battery life on this watch is absolutely insane compared to the apple watch. I exercise at least once a day and sometimes up to four times. The Garmin Forerunner® 965 lasted over 8 days night and day with 13 plus hours of swimming, cycling, running, and lifting workouts. I think I took it off on day 8 with 20 something percent battery left. it is also feels lighter than the apple watch 8. I had the apple watch 8 and Garmin Forerunner® 965 on at the same time for the 8 days, one on each wrist. The data the Garmin Forerunner® 965 has to view is also very impressive with a very nice display.The only reason i didn't keep the Garmin Forerunner® 965 was because it wouldn't work with the apple activity for fitness, my apple watch can text, make calls, take photos with my phone, emails, ect. I think the Garmin Forerunner® 965 is a WAY better fitness watch with a CRAZY battery but it doesn't have the conveniences i am now used to with the apple watch now.If the Garmin Forerunner® 965 could do a couple things the apple watch could (text or work with the apple fitness tracking), I would 100% keep it. If i never had a apple watch and have always used Garmin or other smart watch this watch is an absolute beast. I was very impressed with the watch!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this watch! I upgraded from a Forerunner 935 and the accuracy of the 965 is so much better.I'm not a huge fan of the screen going dark, so I set it to always on. This, of course, shortens the battery life, but I don't mind that too much.What bothers me the most is I can't see seconds all the time. I have to flick my wrist every 15 seconds or so to see the seconds come up. This doesn't sound like much to many people, but if you have to check heart rates all day, that gets old super fast. They can show my HR all the time, why not seconds.The sleep tracking is pretty good, but sometimes it gets confused about when I'm sleeping or not. One day I was just playing video games for most of the day. Chilling after a long hard run, you know how you do. Anyway, it thought I had gone to sleep. haha. And it doesn't like it too well if I get up 2 or 3 times for an hour at a time in the night if I need to tend to a sick or injured animal. But for most regular nights, sleep tracking seems to work.Other than that, not too much to complain about. It's a nice watch and works well in my use cases for trail running and long distance horseback riding.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best fitness watch ever
reviews.reviewText: I have the FR945 and this FR965is better in every way. The most obvious is the screen. It is OLED, full color, bright, and responds to touch. Unlike the 945. But also:The App is improved.The accuracy of many recorded parameters is improved. Sleep is one example (it is better at detecting wake and sleep and types of sleep and it can record naps. And it gives a "morning report" of all sleep and other health paameters.It charges very fast.The screen is highly customizable.The list of improvements goes on and on, even beyond what they advertise.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So many features
reviews.reviewText: This is the best smartwatch I’ve ever owned. Had an Apple Watch for years but wanted something with a little more for triathlon training. You can’t wrong with this watch. Tracks everything and has a lot of customization. This watch really makes you keep an eye on how you’re treating your body. Battery life is incredible if you’re coming from a major phone manufacturer. Usually get over two weeks on a charge and that’s using the watch for training at least 5 sessions a week and sauna sessions.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best for runnning

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars looks like a cheap watch
reviews.reviewText: it looks like a cheap watch compared with the Apple Watch, it's made of plastic and not worth paying for it,i wonder why many people wrote excellently, that you are spending more than 600 $ for this watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nearly the perfect workout/health tracking wearable
reviews.reviewText: I moved to this watch from a Garmin Forerunner 955 Solar which I loved for the exercise/health tracking, sensors, and battery life *except* for the "sunlight-visible, transflective memory-in-pixel" screen which works great in bright sunlight and not so much everywhere else.This watch brings forward everything you like about the functionality of the 955 and add replaces the funky "MIP" screen with AMOLED while still having such a great battery life that it puts to shame the Apple Watch and WearOS watches.The only thing I wish Garmin would add to their watches is a utility to bring the settings forward from an older watch in a series ("Forerunner" or "Fenix") to a newer watch in that same series. I've suggested this to them.Altogether I am completely happy with this watch but expect to spend about a week fine tuning the display settings to get that longer battery life. I started with Always On and almost immediately moved away from that.UPDATE (7/6): I received the watch on June 26th and immediately topped off the battery (it arrived with the battery in the mid-90's). It's July 6th (10 days later) and the battery is at 44% with an estimated duration of another 10 days. That's 21 days of battery life. I'm very satisfied with that. This is why I'm never, ever tempted to order a WearOS, Samsung, or Apple watch.BTW, like all Garmin watches, it works great with the (Android) Garmin Connect app and gives you access to more data analysis in the app than on the watch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this watch!! Brilliant, does everything extremely well. Beautiful screen, great GPS and accuracy. I'm a runner and also do a lot of fitness and this watch is truly amazing. Great quality, great features and superior performance!!
Gostei do prazo de entrega. Foi muito rápido
Vale la pena y a veces hay buenas ofertas, solo hay que estar atento.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's the best watch you'll have owned to date, in this price range.
reviews.reviewText: This watch does absolutely everything, the screen is beautiful, battery life is excellent and with only GPS tracking a few light activities, I was rewarded with 13 days of battery with it around 2% remaining, so quite simply put it has functioned exactly as expected. The watch body seems very light and comfortable - the silicone?? strap has perfect adjustability, and just feels "right". I was surprised by little things, such as the "strength" activity tracking actually correctly detected when I was doing reps of various exercises, and you can track metrics like weight (and others) to review and inform progress, which you can correct/edit later if an error was made. Neato.Some minor perturbances if I'm being picky - sometimes the heartrate monitor is sluggish, which is not the best when you're trying to observe quick changes resulting from effort/output in your activity compared to HR recovery time for example. Also, sometimes when you're twisting your wrist to have the screen wake, it doesn't, and you have to repeat once or a couple times more. Doesn't happen often, and if it bothered me enough and I didn't mind whatever increased battery burn-rate that equates to, I would enable the screen always on. There's more little improvements they can make, I can list a few more, but I'm sure they will update and patch a lot of this stuff throughout it's support lifecycle.All in all, such a solid product. Synced well with speed/cadence sensors, and other Garmin products like inReach Mini 2. It looks classy and is still pragmatic and functional. Doesn't look boorish. Buy it, and you won't regret it! Expensive, but what should something like this cost? It seems fair for what it does and is capable of.

Vengo de usar por 1 año el 945 y este nuevo 965 me sorprendió mucho es igual de cómodo no siento mayor peso y en ocasiones no se siente que lo traes puesto, su batería es muy buena tiene buen aguante lo uso diario ya sea para correr o bici actividades como de 1 horas aprox y me alcanza para más de una semana la batería aveces hasta 2.Aveces cuesta un poco hacer que se active la pantalla para ver la hora como que tienes que hacer un muñequeo más forzado pero nada lejos de ahí.Cuando me llegó a casa llego sin la etiqueta de garantía que suelen venir en los productos nuevos pero revisando videos en YouTube hay varios videos que mencionan lo mismo que ya no trae esa etiqueta transparente la caja de producto nuevo. Todo bien por el momento llevo usándolo 3 semanas.

I've owned 2 previous garmins. Both forerunners. They did ok. However, as my last one was coming to the end of its life, I began looking outside of Garmin. But, after lots of research I kept returning to the 965. I decided to give it a gamble. I'm so glad I did. Crystal clear display, big enough for me to read while running without my glasses, but not too big.The amount of information gathered during a run is very impressive. I like the HRV feature. I previously owned a Whoop and paid monthly for a year. This is much better. Being able to listen to music without bringing my phone along is great.The map feature is a lovely touch, as are the breathing exercise features. I run about 45k a week and I love this watch.
